divs: Sighting DetailsI was walking the dogs with two companions (who didn't see the event) during twilight on a warm May evening. As we walked west along the main road of a major subdivision, I watched the dogs and looked around. From the corner of my eye I saw a bright, white, shining thing up in the sky. Presuming it was just the moon, I looked directly up at it, then saw it was perfectly white, and a perfect half-circle. Imagine the moon when it's only half lit. It was already in motion when it caught my eye, and it was arcing upward, lightning-quick, from south up to west. And before I could open my mouth to announce it, it disappeared. I kept watch of that section of sky, trying to find it again, but it was gone. Unfortunately, both my companions had been engaged in conversation and so, missed what I saw. Sizewise, to the naked eye, it appeared about the same size as the full moon, except that this was a perfect half-circle, with the left half lit brightly and the right half empty. It was featureless, no details of any kind were seen in the quick burst that I saw it. Immediately, I deduced I must have just glanced very quickly at the moon and blurred it by looking away quickly. Wrong. I found it nowhere near where I saw the white half-circle, and it was just a faint, tiny sliver of a crescent moon. I was excited to see it; I just wish it hadn't disappeared so quickly. I would have liked to see its details.
Summary: White, shining Half-Circle arcing from S to W
